office: Rules Committee Ranking Member Louise Slaughter (NY-25)
requirements: expert social media manager with attention to detail

office: Senior Member of the House Foreign Affairs Committee
key_responsibilities: handle foreign policy and related issues
requirements: background in foreign policy and/or an advanced degree
strong organizational and time management skills

key_responsibilities: managing the member’s Washington, D.C. schedule
managing meeting, speaking and traveling requests
requirements: able to work in a fast-paced environment
excellent oral and written communication skills

key_responsibilities: coordinating with the legislative team and member to develop and implement all communications activities for the office
drafting op-eds, speeches, press releases, and newsletters
requirements: persuasive advocate for individual liberty, economic freedom, and the Constitution
demonstrate a breadth of policy knowledge
ability to exercise sound, independent judgment
at least two years of professional experience

key_responsibilities: management of an active constituent correspondence program
requirements: strong organizational and time management skills

key_responsibilities: develop and maintain Member’s DC and district schedule
planning domestic and international travel logistics
assisting with the Member’s personal correspondence
requirements: work well in a team environment

key_responsibilities: develop and implement aggressive communications strategy with local and national media
writing press releases, speeches, op-eds, talking points, franked mail pieces and newsletters
setting up press events and press conferences
coordinating the office’s online and social media operations
requirements: strong written and oral communication skills
ability to work well with legislative and district office staff
minimum of 3-5 years of communications experience
demonstrated understanding of federal politics and policy
desire to work in a fast-paced and fluid environment
availability for evening and weekend assignments

key_responsibilities: serving as the office's primary point of contact for constituents, elected officials, and nonprofit and advocacy organizations
working directly with the district director, the legislator, and his family
assisting the Capitol office and District Director on maintaining financial and expense records
requirements: experience working in a fast-paced office
ability to maintain a professional, flexible, and cheerful demeanor

office: New England Democrat and member of the House Veterans’ Affairs Committee

excellent written and oral communication skills
comfortable working both independently and as part of a team

key_responsibilities: develop and maintain Member’s official schedule
organize domestic and international travel logistics
work closely with the chief of staff on administrative duties

work well in a team environment

key_responsibilities: providing support to the congressman and legislative staff
management of an active constituent correspondence program
